thread.title: Can We Talk About How Onion Dip Is Underrated?
thread.title_full: Can We Talk About How Onion Dip Is Underrated?

author: Munchies Staff
title: Can We Talk About How Onion Dip Is Underrated?
text:
Can We Talk About How Onion Dip Is Underrated? January 23, 2017 / 10:00 am By Munchies Staff 
Overrated: truffle oil. Accurately rated : tuna melts. Seriously underrated: onion dip. 
Is there anything more addictive? Throw us in front of a bowl of this stuff with a bag of Ruffles and we’re the hungriest and most helpless of binge-eaters. 
Should you choose to go deep on this party favorite, it pays to make your own instead of adhering to the old onion-soup-and-sour-cream version (though there’s plenty to be said about that, too). This recipe starts with real actual onion as well as onion flakes and onion powder. Hell, caramelized onions add a touch of sweetness and Worcestershire sauce add a serious pop of umami in this twist on a classic favorite.
